# How to include image into a CSS file

Normaly you do it this way:

```css
div {
  background-image: url('img/image.png');
}
```

To include encoded image use `data:<mimetype>;base64,<data>`. Data is the image encoded via [Base64](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64).
For example:

```css
div {
  background-image: url('data:image/png;base64,');
}
```

You can do the same with SVG images:

```css
div {
  background-image: url('data:image/svg+xml;base64,');
}
```

To encode image with _Base64_ use:

```
base64 file.png
```

or using OpneSSL:

```
openssl enc -base64 -in file.png | tr -d "\n"
```

More info on [Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_URI_scheme).
